items.content_html:
Description

Add a more useful example for understanding :last-of-type pseudo-classes selector.

Motivation

The example shown already is good but not suitable for complicated situations. I came across a problem and applied a solution in my example.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add a useful example for understanding.

items.content_html:
Note: I'm fairly certain this is actually a typo and that I'm not meant to be interpreting it according to the subtle and complicated meaning the typo yields.

The presumed typo saying event changed the original meaning: "There is a small set of low entropy client hint headers that may be sent by a client event if not requested." There it sounds like we're referring to requests as 'events' and that the low entropy hints are sent specifically when they are not requested, which has a distinct enough meaning that a reader might assume there's something very subtle they need to understand about this class of hints.

With the typo fixed, the meaning is different, accurate, and more straightforward for a reader to utilize: "There is a small set of low entropy client hint headers that may be sent by a client even if not requested."
items.title: fix: typo that resulted in different meaning

items.content_html:
Description

Documents the composition of the content script global.

Motivation

Content scripts in extensions behave somewhat consistently across browsers, except when they don't. This is currently not clearly documented, and occasionally confuses extension developers.

Additional details

Related bugs:

  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1208775 (and linked bugs)
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1288284

Examples of bugs showing confusion from extension developers:

  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1577400
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1681809
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1814898

Related issues and pull requests

None
items.title: Document composition of content script global

items.content_html:
Description

This PR adds documentation for the WebGPU API (or, at least some of it, we might have to break it up into multiple PRs as it is quite big). This is expected to land in Chrome 114 or so (around April-ish).

Other notes:

  • There is currently no WebGPU spec or compat data written for MDN. This will be added to https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data soon, so don't worry about the related errors showing up.
  • A lot of the red broken links are currently down to the fact that many of the API reference pages are not yet written. These will become fewer in time.
  • The basic examples I wrote to go along with these docs are currently stored on glitch, but I'll put them on an MDN demo repo before the final publication.

You can see full details of the changes expected in this PR in my research document.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #23336
items.title: WebGPU API docs

items.content_html:
While migrating an extension from MV2 to MV3, I followed the guide and ran into an error. Updating the path to the same value that worked in MV2 (relative to the calling script) fixed the issue.

Description

Additional details
